testcase.brief: Vpn tunnel should be recreated after mgt0 ip changed on CVG
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
-config a remote CVG, there are several LANs behind it -there are some services in CVG's LANs -BR setup VPN connection with CVG -setup all wifi radio and eth interfaces as access mode -BR have several LANs behind it -STA1 connected to BR's LAN -vpn tunnel setup success
Test Procedure:
-change the ip of mgt0 on CVG

step.desc: enable wan port nat if FW nonexists
config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: config mgt0.2 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server enable"

step.multi-setvar: echo "br1.br.mgt0.1.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "br1.br.mgt0.2.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.dns1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.dns1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.dns2.route=$(echo ${cvg1.dns2.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.vpc1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0"

step.desc: Check route distribution is correct
On GW, will add the tunnel routes according to BR's modification
-check the ip route tablelist
setup eth interface as access mode
set all wired interface as access mode eth1 access br1.vpc1.vlan, eth2 trunk with native-vlan br1.vpc2.vlan
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport user-profile-attribute 1"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 get ip addr from dhcp server of mgt0.1
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
Enable debug, Check BR connectivities
BR ping br1.vpc1
br1.vpc1 ping cvg1.vpc1
enable debug on BR
-change the ip of mgt0 on CVG
check gre tunnel on br side remote to CVG wan address, local mgt0 address ,gateway CVG public address
check gre tunnel on cvg side local to CVG wan address
On GW, will add the tunnel routes
On BR, will update the tunnel routes according to CVG's modification
3. after tunnel is down, the tunnel routes should be removed 4. after tunnel is up, the tunnel routes should be added correctly
step.log-match: -b "VPN gateway mgt0\(${cvg1.cvg.tmp.ip}\) route: ip route add blackhole ${cvg1.cvg.tmp.ip}/32 table t_internal_drop" -ps p "VPN gateway mgt0\(${cvg1.cvg.tmp.ip}\) route: ip route add ${cvg1.cvg.tmp.ip}/32 dev tunnel0 table t_exception" -ps p "VPN gateway mgt0\(${cvg1.cvg.tmp.ip}\) route: ip route add ${cvg1.cvg.tmp.ip}/32 dev tunnel0 table t_all" -ps p "VPN gateway mgt0\(${cvg1.cvg.tmp.ip}\) route: ip route add ${cvg1.cvg.tmp.ip}/32 dev tunnel0 table main" -ps p "established ipsec tunnel with ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip}\[4500\]\(phase2 up/rekey\)" -ps p"IKE ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip}\[4500\]> Phase 2 established" -ps p "IKE ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip}\[4500\]> compute IV for phase 2" -ps p "IKE ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip}\[4500\]> Phase 1 established" -e "IKE ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip}.*> Phase 1 started" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: br1.vpc1 ping vcg1.vpc1
